Explain for all :
1.The main characters are the government
2.„ÄäI fill my eyes with kerosene, let everything burn„Äã- the government does not want to look at what is happening in Russia (they do not care) 
3.„ÄäI served my time on the Internet„Äã- term for reposts/likes/comments 
4.„ÄäGo out to stroke the cat, but it moved takka ment„Äã - lawlessness in law enforcement
5.„ÄäGo out on the street in black hoodies, there's usually some cold and evil people„Äã - about the population of Russia (bydlo/Gopnik)
6.„ÄäThere is nothing ahead of me„Äã - young people do not know what awaits them in the future 
7.„ÄäIn gold chains I'm drowning in a swamp„Äã- our country is rich in natural resources, but we still live in poverty
8.„ÄäTogether with others you will twist in the square„Äã- everything is clear 
9.‚ô™And I'll curl up in my new living space‚ô™ in my coffin
10.„ÄäThere is no more death„Äã - the dead do not die.

Now the visual part
 1. A man throwing a match shows the government trying to silence the people.
2. Eating raw meat shows that the government "eats" the people (Increase in VAT, retirement age)
3. The main characters sitting on the neck of the riot Police - law enforcement agencies are trying to please their superiors.
4. Cigarette - censorship in Russia.
5. Drowning - the government is pulling the country to the bottom.
@Moor: "will have peace while liberalism is dominant", just as no country will have peace as long as authoritarianism and dictatorship prevail. And what's your problem with liberalism?
@Moor: anyway, if you take any liberal country and compare it with an authoritarian one, the latter will always lose. Especially such as Russia
@Moor: socialism is good in theory, in practice socialism is even worse in some things than classic regimes
@Moor: how exactly is this used to destabilize the regime?
